intro: Hieracium coniocephalum, commonly known as the white hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features bright yellow ray flowers surrounding a dense, white disk flower, giving it a distinctive appearance. It typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun. Hieracium coniocephalum is an annual or biennial plant, often found in temperate climates.
